dt: {bc}a long stick carried in the hand for support in walking
{bc}a crosspiece in a ladder or chair {bc}{sx|rung||}
{bc}a rod carried as a symbol of office or authority
{bc}the horizontal lines with their spaces on which music is written
{bc}any of various graduated sticks or rules used for measuring {bc}{sx|rod||}
{bc}the officers chiefly responsible for the internal operations of an institution or business
{bc}a group of officers appointed to assist a civil executive or commanding officer
{bc}military or naval officers not eligible for operational command
{bc}the personnel who assist a director in carrying out an assigned task

et: Middle English {it}staf{/it}, from Old English {it}stæf{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}stab{/it} staff, Sanskrit {it}stabhnāti{/it} he supports
shortdef: a long stick carried in the hand for support in walking

dt: {bc}to supply with a staff or with workers
{bc}to serve as a staff member of

shortdef: to supply with a staff or with workers
to serve as a staff member of

dt: {bc}a conventionalized representation of a staff branched at the top with a single snake twined around it that is used as a symbol of medicine and as the official insignia of the American Medical Association

et: after {it}Aesculapius{/it}, Greco-Roman god of medicine, from Latin, from Greek {it}Asklēpios{/it}
shortdef: a conventionalized representation of a staff branched at the top with a single snake twined around it that is used as a symbol of medicine and as the official insignia of the American Medical Association —called also rod of Asclepius, rod of Aesculapius

dt: {bc}a commissioned officer assigned to a military commander's staff {dx}compare {dxt|line officer||}{/dx}

shortdef: a commissioned officer assigned to a military commander's staff
a staple of diet; especially : bread

dt: {bc}a noncommissioned officer ranking in the army above a sergeant and below a platoon sergeant or sergeant first class, in the air force above a sergeant and below a technical sergeant, and in the marine corps above a sergeant and below a gunnery sergeant

shortdef: a noncommissioned officer ranking in the army above a sergeant and below a platoon sergeant or sergeant first class, in the air force above a sergeant and below a technical sergeant, and in the marine corps above a sergeant and below a gunnery sergeant

dt: {bc}a noncommissioned officer in the army ranking above a master sergeant

shortdef: a noncommissioned officer in the army ranking above a master sergeant

dt: {bc}any of a genus ({it}Celastrus{/it} of the family Celastraceae, the staff-tree family) of mostly twining shrubby plants including the common bittersweet

shortdef: any of a genus (Celastrus of the family Celastraceae, the staff-tree family) of mostly twining shrubby plants including the common bittersweet

dt: {bc}a nurse who is on the staff of a hospital

shortdef: a nurse who is on the staff of a hospital
